titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Whittaker Family Charles Dickens Manuscript Collection, 1831-2003
titlestmt.author: Inventory prepared by Laura Streett

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Laura Streett April 2009.

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Whittaker Family Charles Dickens Manuscript Collection

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: Correspondence, sheet music, playbills, artwork, ephemera, realia as well as other miscellany relating to Dickens and his work.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Victorian writer Charles Dickens (1812-1870) was one of the most well-known celebrities of his day, and his work continues to appeal to a large and diverse audience. His popularity is evident in the myriad editions and re-interpretations of his novels and short stories, but also in the presence of Dickens and his characters in a wide array of material culture.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Whittaker Family Charles Dickens Manuscript Collection includes correspondence, sheet music, playbills, artwork, ephemera, realia as well as other miscellany relating to Dickens and his work. The variety of objects in various formats, styles and composition, created while Dickens was alive but also well after his death, illustrates the enduring popularity of the author's work. Of particular note are original watercolors by both Hablot K. Browne and Joseph Clayton Clarke ("Kyd").
For more information about the history and significance of this collection, see the digital exhibit, Charles Dickens in the Marketplace.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library.

p.archref: Whittaker Family Charles Dickens Book Collection
Dickens material in the Vassar College Autograph Files

odd.head: Encoding Information
odd.p: Encoded by Laura Streett, April 2009. Updated by Emma Gronbeck, January 2024.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Laura Streett and Jared Barenholz, 2008-2009.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Whittaker Family Charles Dickens Manuscript Collection, Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.
